data.title: AUGUST Events in Vancouver 2024
data.meta_description: Vancouver's 2024 August calendar features dates and events including summer festivals, concerts, outdoor movies, night markets and BC Day holiday events.
data.text:
Vancouver’s 2024 August calendar features dates and events including summer festivals, concerts, outdoor movies, night markets and BC Day holiday events.

JANUARY – FEBRUARY – MARCH – APRIL

MAY – JUNE – JULY – AUGUST – SEPTEMBER

OCTOBER – NOVEMBER – DECEMBER

Vancouver’s August Calendar of Events

August 5, 2024 – BC Day (Stat Holiday).

August Events in Vancouver

Below is what’s happening on the different days of the month in August 2024. (Note: Event dates and details are subject to change.)

Week of August 16th to 18th

August 16-18 | August 19-25 | August 26-31

Friday, August 16, 2024

Symphony in the Park – a free concert at Abbotsford’s Mill Lake Park. The event includes music by Beethoven, Mozart, Strauss and other famous classical composers, but also more modern tunes including from the movie The Pirates of the Caribbean.

Ribfest Langley – a family-friendly community event hosted by Langley Rotary Clubs. Festivities include live entertainment, a KidZone, beer garden and lots of great food! Admission is by donation.

Shipyards Night Market – live music and market activities at Shipbuilder’s Square in North Vancouver.

Chilliwack Mural Fest – murals, self-guided tours and other activities in downtown Chilliwack.

Bard on the Beach – Shakespearean theatre at Vanier Park. Today features Twelfth Night and The Comedy of Errors.

The Improv Centre – live comedy theatre at Granville Island. Tonight’s shows are Theatresports and Theatresports Unhinged.

Theatre Under the Stars – outdoor musical theatre in Stanley Park. Tonight features School of Rock.

Playland – Vancouver’s amusement park at the PNE.

Dance Dance Dance – free Latin Dance lessons in the plaza outside the Queen Elizabeth Theatre in the evening.

Burnaby Summer Cinema – a free film shows outdoors in Burnaby.

Chilliwack Corn Maze – a world-famous corn maze and kid-friendly activities at Greendale Acres in the Fraser Valley.

Featured Attractions & Activities

WildPlay Element Park – ropes courses and ziplines at the outdoor adventure facility in Maple Ridge. (TIP: Use the promo code VBP15 and save 15%.)

FlyOver Canada – the film about Canada shows at the multi-dimensional theatre at Canada Place. Today also features Legendary Iceland: Landscapes and Lore.

Guided Tours at the FRDC – tours can be booked for this morning at New Westminster’s Fraser River Discovery Centre (because it’s Friday).

Forbidden Vancouver Walking Tours – guided tours in downtown Vancouver. Today’s tours are Lost Souls of Gastown, Forbidden Vancouver, and Hidden History & Sweet Treats.

Vancouver Maritime Museum – the family-friendly museum at Vanier Park. (TIP: Use the promo code BESTVANCOUVER and save 25%.)

Zero Latency – a virtual reality games centre where you can battle zombies, aliens and other creatures in Vancouver and Langley. (TIP: Save 10% when you book your game with the promo code VBP2024.)

Vancouver Mysteries Games – outdoor adventure games in downtown Vancouver. (TIP: Use promo code BESTPLACES and save 10% on games.)

Fort Langley – the national historic site in Fort Langley is a great place to explore (and children ages 17 and under get in for free).

MONOVA – the Museum of North Vancouver is where you’ll learn about the history of the Shipyards and Vancouver’s North Shore.

Britannia Mine – the historic mining museum at Britannia Beach (which is half an hour north of Horseshoe Bay on the way to Squamish and Whistler).

Capilano Suspension Bridge – the world-famous attraction is a great place to visit. (TIP: BC residents can get an annual pass for the same price as a single-day ticket!)

Chinese Canadian Museum – a relatively new museum full of information and things to see in Vancouver’s Chinatown.

Saturday, August 17, 2024

Ribfest Langley – a family-friendly community event hosted by Langley Rotary Clubs. Festivities include live entertainment, a KidZone, beer garden and lots of great food! Admission is by donation.

The PNE Fair – Vancouver’s annual summer fair. Tonight’s Summer Night Concert is with Burton Cummings and Colin James.

Chilliwack Corn Maze – Tanner Olsen performs as part of the Sundown Music Series and Summer Country Jam at Greendale Acre Farms.

Chilliwack Mural Fest – murals, self-guided tours and other activities in downtown Chilliwack.

A Feast in the Flower Field – a long-table dinner event raising money for Vancouver Farmers Markets’ Fresh to Families Fund in Delta.

Edmonds Classic Car Show – a street festival and car show along Edmonds Street in Burnaby.

Chilliwack Flight Fest – a community event at the Chilliwack Airport.

Northwest Mud Racing – truck racing in the mud at Chilliwack Heritage Park in the Fraser Valley.

Festival of India – a Hare Krishna festival at Creekside Park near Science World. Today features a Kirtan and feasting.

Movies Under the Stars – Barbie shows for free outdoors at Surrey’s Holland Park.

Port Coquitlam Car Show – a car show featuring hundreds of cars in downtown Port Coquitlam. Admission for the public is free.

Squamish Arts Festival – a community event featuring art, music and performing arts.

Burnaby Artisan Farmers Market – farmers, artisan vendors and live music in the parking lot at Burnaby City Hall (not far from Deer Lake Park and Burnaby Village).

Other Saturday Farmers Markets – in Abbotsford, Fort Langley, Maple Ridge, Riley Park, Squamish, Trout Lake and the West End.

Live Theatre

Bard on the Beach – Shakespearean theatre at Vanier Park. Today features Hamlet and Measure for Measure.

Theatre Under the Stars – outdoor musical theatre in Stanley Park. Tonight features CATS.

The Improv Centre – live comedy theatre at Granville Island. Tonight’s shows are Theatresports and Theatresports Unhinged.

Walking Tours & Outdoor Adventures

WildPlay Element Park – ropes courses and ziplines at the outdoor adventure facility in Maple Ridge. (TIP: Use the promo code VBP15 and save 15%.)

Forbidden Vancouver Walking Tours – guided tours in downtown Vancouver. Today’s tours are Lost Souls of Gastown, Forbidden Vancouver, Hidden History & Sweet Treats, and the Dark Secrets of Stanley Park.

Vancouver Mysteries Games – outdoor adventure games in downtown Vancouver. (TIP: Use promo code BESTPLACES and save 10% on games.)

Featured Attractions & Activities

FlyOver Canada – the film about Canada shows at the multi-dimensional theatre at Canada Place. Today also features Legendary Iceland: Landscapes and Lore.

Vancouver Maritime Museum – the family-friendly museum at Vanier Park. (TIP: Use the promo code BESTVANCOUVER and save 25%.)

Chinese Canadian Museum – a relatively new museum full of information and things to see in Vancouver’s Chinatown.

Capilano Suspension Bridge – the world-famous attraction is a great place to visit. (TIP: BC residents can get an annual pass for the same price as a single-day ticket!)

Railway Museum of BC – a large museum with trains and railway artifacts in Squamish.

Britannia Mine – the historic mining museum at Britannia Beach (which is half an hour north of Horseshoe Bay on the way to Squamish and Whistler).

Guided Tours at the FRDC – tours can be booked for this morning at New Westminster’s Fraser River Discovery Centre.

Fort Langley – the national historic site in Fort Langley is a great place to explore (and children ages 17 and under get in for free).

Zero Latency – a virtual reality games centre where you can battle zombies, aliens and other creatures in Vancouver and Langley. (TIP: Save 10% when you book your game with the promo code VBP2024.)

MONOVA – the Museum of North Vancouver is where you’ll learn about the history of the Shipyards and Vancouver’s North Shore.

Other Activities

Camping Opportunities – there are lots of great campgrounds in the Lower Mainland (providing you can find a spot).

Lower Mainland Beaches – beaches at Ambleside, Crescent Beach, White Rock, Stanley Park, Kitsilano, Belcarra Park and elsewhere are especially popular this time of year.

Lower Mainland Parks – if good weather, various parks and places in nature are “best places” to be!

Vancouver Golf Courses – check out our list of top places to hit a ball around outdoors in the fresh air.

Sunday, August 18, 2024

Ribfest Langley – a family-friendly community event hosted by Langley Rotary Clubs. Festivities include live entertainment, a KidZone, beer garden and lots of great food! Admission is by donation.

Chilliwack Corn Maze – a world-famous corn maze and kid-friendly activities at Greendale Acres in the Fraser Valley.

The PNE Fair – Vancouver’s annual summer fair. Tonight’s Summer Night Concert is with Amanda Marshall and Serena Ryder.

Family Day at the Bard – matinee Shakespearean shows with special pricing and kid-friendly activities. Today’s shows are Twelfth Night and The Comedy of Errors.

Port Moody Car Free Day – a free event along a few blocks of Johns Street in Port Moody.

Chilliwack Flight Fest – a community event with planes to see and aerial shows at the Chilliwack Airport. Admission is by donation.

Elevate Fashion Festival – a Vancouver Independent Fashion Flair event with local designers, models, DJs and other entertainment at the Parq Vancouver Hotel in downtown.

Northwest Mud Racing – truck racing in the mud at Chilliwack Heritage Park in the Fraser Valley.

Festival of India – a Hare Krishna festival at Creekside Park near Science World. Today features the full festival including a parade.

Theatre Under the Stars – outdoor musical theatre in Stanley Park. Tonight features School of Rock.

Port Coquitlam Car Show – a car show featuring hundreds of cars in downtown Port Coquitlam. Admission for the public is free.

Summer Sundays – free live music at Rocky Point Park in Port Moody.

Corn Mazes – farms with family-friendly activities including mazes to get lost in at various venues throughout the Lower Mainland.

Featured Attractions & Activities

Vancouver Maritime Museum – the family-friendly museum at Vanier Park. (TIP: Use the promo code BESTVANCOUVER and save 25%!)

WildPlay Element Park – ropes courses and ziplines at the outdoor adventure facility in Maple Ridge. (TIP: Use the promo code VBP15 and save 15%.)

Vancouver Mysteries Games – outdoor adventure games in downtown Vancouver. (TIP: Use promo code BESTPLACES and save 10% on games.)

Guided Tours at the FRDC – tours can be booked for this morning at New Westminster’s Fraser River Discovery Centre (because it’s Sunday).

Forbidden Vancouver Walking Tours – guided tours in downtown Vancouver. Today’s tours are Lost Souls of Gastown, Forbidden Vancouver, Hidden History & Sweet Treats, and the Really Gay History Tour.

FlyOver Canada – the film about Canada shows at the multi-dimensional theatre at Canada Place. Today also features Legendary Iceland: Landscapes and Lore.

Capilano Suspension Bridge – the world-famous attraction is a great place to visit. (TIP: BC residents can get an annual pass for the same price as a single-day ticket!)

Chinese Canadian Museum – a relatively new museum full of information and things to see in Vancouver’s Chinatown.

MONOVA – the Museum of North Vancouver is where you’ll learn about the history of the Shipyards and Vancouver’s North Shore.

Tours with Shipyard Pals – walking tours take place around the Shipyards District in North Vancouver. (This event is hosted by the Museum of North Vancouver.)

Zero Latency – a virtual reality games centre where you can battle zombies, aliens and other creatures in Vancouver and Langley. (TIP: Save 10% when you book your game with the promo code VBP2024.)

Fort Langley – the national historic site in Fort Langley is a great place to explore (and children ages 17 and under get in for free).

Britannia Mine – the historic mining museum at Britannia Beach (which is half an hour north of Horseshoe Bay on the way to Squamish and Whistler).

Sunday Markets

Ambleside Artisan Farmers Market – farmers and other food and artisan vendors are at beautiful Ambleside Beach in West Vancouver.

Brentwood Artisan Farmers Market – a new market at the Amazing Brentwood Mall in Burnaby.

Junction Public Market – an outdoor artisan market near Waterfront Station.

Other Sunday Farmers Markets – in Chilliwack, Clayton Heights, Coquitlam, Kitsilano, Steveston Village, Whistler and White Rock.

Vancouver Flea Market – at 703 Terminal Avenue.

Cloverdale Flea Market – a massive market at the Cloverdale Fairgrounds in Surrey.

Week of August 19th to 25th

August 16-18 | August 19-25 | August 26-31

Monday, August 19, 2024

Theatre Under the Stars – outdoor musical theatre in Stanley Park. Tonight features CATS.

Corn Mazes – farms with family-friendly activities including mazes to get lost in at various venues throughout the Lower Mainland.

Featured Attractions & Activities

Britannia Mine – the historic mining museum at Britannia Beach (which is half an hour north of Horseshoe Bay on the way to Squamish and Whistler).

Camping Opportunities – there are lots of great campgrounds in the Lower Mainland (providing you can find a spot).

Lower Mainland Golf Courses – check out our list of top places to hit a ball around outdoors in the fresh air.

Tuesday, August 20, 2024

The PNE Fair – Vancouver’s annual summer fair. Tonight’s Summer Night Concert is with Bachman-Turner Overdrive.

Bard on the Beach – Shakespearean theatre at Vanier Park. Today features Twelfth Night and Measure for Measure.

Theatre Under the Stars – outdoor musical theatre in Stanley Park. Tonight features School of Rock.

Corn Mazes – farms with family-friendly activities including mazes to get lost in at various venues throughout the Lower Mainland.

Stanley Park Summer Cinema – a free screening of Twilight at Second Beach in Stanley Park.

Vancouver Canadians Baseball – the team plays against Everett at Nat Bailey Stadium.

Cheap Movie Night – at most theatres throughout the Lower Mainland.

Brahm’s Tams Drum Circle – drumming at Stanley Park’s Third Beach.

Lower Mainland Beaches – beaches at Ambleside, Crescent Beach, White Rock, Stanley Park, Kitsilano, Belcarra Park and elsewhere are especially popular this time of year.

Fort Langley – the national historic site in Fort Langley is a great place to explore (and children ages 17 and under get in for free).

Wednesday, August 21, 2024

The PNE Fair – Vancouver’s annual summer fair. Tonight’s Summer Night Concert is with Daryl Hall.

Sunset Cinema – a movie shows tonight at šxʷƛ̓exən Xwtl’a7shn in the plaza outside Vancouver’s Queen Elizabeth Theatre. The event is free and features pre-show entertainment.

Wizard of Oz at Kilby – a musical production at the Kilby Historic Site in Harrison Mills.

Art Downtown – local artists display their art today from 11 am to 5 pm in downtown Vancouver (assuming good weather).

Downtown Farmers Market – from 2 until 6 pm in the North Plaza outside the Vancouver Art Gallery.

Surrey Sounds of Summer Music Series – a free outdoor concert at Unwin Park in Surrey.

Vancouver Mysteries Games – outdoor adventure games in downtown Vancouver. (TIP: Use promo code BESTPLACES and save 10% on games.)

Bard on the Beach – Shakespearean theatre at Vanier Park. Today features Hamlet and The Comedy of Errors.

Theatre Under the Stars – outdoor musical theatre in Stanley Park. Tonight features CATS.

Improv Centre Theatre – live comedy theatre at Granville Island. Tonight’s show is Date Night.

Vancouver Canadians Baseball – the team plays against Everett at Nat Bailey Stadium.

Mission Twilight Concerts – free live music at Fraser River Heritage Park at 7 pm.

Chilliwack Corn Maze – a world-famous corn maze and kid-friendly activities at Greendale Acres in the Fraser Valley. Today also features the Golden Hour Flower Workshop.

Featured Attractions & Activities

Vancouver Maritime Museum – the family-friendly museum at Vanier Park. (TIP: Use the promo code BESTVANCOUVER and save 25%.)

WildPlay Element Park – ropes courses and ziplines at the outdoor adventure facility in Maple Ridge. (TIP: Use the promo code VBP15 and save 15%.)

Capilano Suspension Bridge – the world-famous attraction is a great place to visit. (TIP: BC residents can get an annual pass for the same price as a single-day ticket!)

Fort Langley – the national historic site in Fort Langley is a great place to explore (and children ages 17 and under get in for free).

Thursday, August 22, 2024

The PNE Fair – Vancouver’s annual summer fair. Tonight’s Summer Night Concert is with John Fogerty.

Improv Centre Theatre – live comedy theatre at Granville Island. Tonight’s show is Summer Blockbuster.

Theatre Under the Stars – outdoor musical theatre in Stanley Park. Tonight features School of Rock.

False Creek Farmers Market – a small market not far from Science World at the eastern end of False Creek.

Wizard of Oz at Kilby – a musical production at the Kilby Historic Site in Harrison Mills.

Deckchair Cinema – a film plays shows at the waterfront in North Vancouver with admission by donation.

Concerts at the Pier – an evening concert in White Rock.

New West Farmers Market – at Tipperary Park in New Westminster.

Chilliwack Corn Maze – a world-famous corn maze and kid-friendly activities at Greendale Acres in the Fraser Valley.

Vancouver Canadians Baseball – the team plays against Everett at Nat Bailey Stadium. Tonight is also a fireworks night!

Featured Attractions & Activities

MONOVA – the Museum of North Vancouver is where you’ll learn about the history of the Shipyards and Vancouver’s North Shore. Today also features Lower Lonsdale Walking Tours.

Britannia Mine – the historic mining museum at Britannia Beach (which is half an hour north of Horseshoe Bay on the way to Squamish and Whistler).

Zero Latency – a virtual reality games centre where you can battle zombies, aliens and other creatures in Vancouver and Langley. (TIP: Save 10% when you book your game with the promo code VBP2024.)

Capilano Suspension Bridge – the world-famous attraction is a great place to visit. (TIP: BC residents can get an annual pass for the same price as a single-day ticket!)

Fort Langley – the national historic site in Fort Langley is a great place to explore (and children ages 17 and under get in for free).

FlyOver Canada – the film about Canada shows at the multi-dimensional theatre at Canada Place. Today also features Legendary Iceland: Landscapes and Lore.

Corn Mazes – farms with family-friendly activities including mazes to get lost in at various venues throughout the Lower Mainland.

Lower Mainland Parks – if good weather, various parks and places in nature are “best places” to be!

Vancouver Golf Courses – check out our list of top places to hit a ball around outdoors in the fresh air.

Shipyards Night Market – live music and market activities at Shipbuilder’s Square in North Vancouver.

The PNE Fair – Vancouver’s annual summer fair. Tonight’s Summer Night Concert is with Brad Paisley.

Bard on the Beach – Shakespearean theatre at Vanier Park. Today features Twelfth Night and The Comedy of Errors.

Vancouver Canadians Baseball – the team plays against Everett at Nat Bailey Stadium.

Chilliwack Corn Maze – a world-famous corn maze and kid-friendly activities at Greendale Acres in the Fraser Valley.

Saturday, August 24, 2024

Salmon Sessions Music Festival – a music festival in Surrey that’s a fundraising event for the Little Campbell Salmon Hatchery.

Farewell to Summer Fireworks – an artisan market, live entertainment and fireworks in New Westminster.

World of Love Multicultural Carnival – a festival with live entertainment, food, family-friendly activities and free admission at Town Centre Park in Coquitlam.

The PNE Fair – Vancouver’s annual summer fair. Tonight’s Summer Night Show is with Gerry Dee.

Tour de Cure – a fundraising event benefiting the BC Cancer Foundation. Today’s leg of the event goes from Cloverdale to Chilliwack.

Wizard of Oz at Kilby – a musical production at the Kilby Historic Site in Harrison Mills.

Turtle Island Festival – the largest Indigenous music and arts festival in Canada takes place today at Sunset Beach.

Rotary’s Chilliwack Book Sale – an outdoor book sale raising funds for projects supported by the Rotary Club of Chilliwack at 44870 Wolfe Road (near Townsend Park).

Richmond Maritime Festival – a festival at Britannia Shipyard in Steveston Village.

Steveston Dragon Boat Festival – dragon boat races in Steveston Village.

Granville Block Party – a two-day event with live music in the street near Robson Square.

Vancouver Canadians Baseball – the team plays against Everett at Nat Bailey Stadium.

Chilliwack Corn Maze – Larry Edwards performs as part of the Sundown Music Series at Greendale Acre Farms.

Theatre in Vancouver

Bard on the Beach – Shakespearean theatre at Vanier Park. Today features Twelfth Night and Measure for Measure.

Theatre Under the Stars – last day of the season for the outdoor musical theatre in Stanley Park. Tonight features School of Rock.

The Improv Centre – live comedy theatre at Granville Island. Tonight’s shows are Theatresports and Unhinged with Kevin McDonald.

Featured Attractions & Activities

Capilano Suspension Bridge – the world-famous attraction is a great place to visit. (TIP: BC residents can get an annual pass for the same price as a single-day ticket!)

Forbidden Vancouver Walking Tours – guided tours in downtown Vancouver. Today’s tours are Lost Souls of Gastown, Forbidden Vancouver, Hidden History & Sweet Treats, Dark Secrets of Stanley Park and The Last Gang In Town.

Super Weekend: Food of the Fraser – the Fraser River Discovery Centre in New Westminster offers special programming this weekend.

Vancouver Maritime Museum – the family-friendly museum at Vanier Park. (TIP: Use the promo code BESTVANCOUVER and save 25%.)

Fort Langley – the national historic site in Fort Langley is a great place to explore (and children ages 17 and under get in for free).

Other Saturday Farmers Markets – in Abbotsford, Fort Langley, Maple Ridge, Riley Park, Squamish, Trout Lake and the West End. (Note: All these have free admission.)

Richmond Night Market – an Asian-themed market with food trucks and market vendors in Richmond. (Admission costs about $8.)

Sunday, August 25, 2024

The PNE Fair – Vancouver’s annual summer fair. Tonight’s Summer Night Concert is with Charlotte Cardin.

Chilliwack Corn Maze – a world-famous corn maze and kid-friendly activities at Greendale Acres in the Fraser Valley.

Tour de Cure – a fundraising event benefiting the BC Cancer Foundation. Today’s leg of the event goes from Chilliwack to Hope.

Richmond Maritime Festival – a free festival at Britannia Shipyard in Steveston Village.

Granville Block Party – a two-day event with live music in the street near Robson Square.

Richmond Night Market – an Asian-themed market with food trucks and market vendors in Richmond. (Admission costs about $8.)

Vancouver Canadians Baseball – the team plays against Everett at Nat Bailey Stadium.

Music & Theatre

Bard on the Beach – Shakespearean theatre at Vanier Park. Today features Hamlet and The Comedy of Errors.

FlyOver Canada – the film about Canada shows at the multi-dimensional theatre at Canada Place. Today also features Legendary Iceland: Landscapes and Lore.

Summer Sundays – free live music at Rocky Point Park in Port Moody.

MONOVA – the Museum of North Vancouver is where you’ll learn about the history of the Shipyards and Vancouver’s North Shore. Today features extra activities for the Create & Connect Series.

Vancouver Mysteries Games – outdoor adventure games in downtown Vancouver. (TIP: Use promo code BESTPLACES and save 10% on games.)

Typical August Weather

Summers in Vancouver are typically very dry, with August being one of the warmest and driest months of the year.

The city can sometimes practically go without any rain from the beginning of July until late August, with the first real summer rains coming just in time for the PNE fair in the last week or so of the month.

The days in August are warm (for Vancouver), but the evenings are starting to get cool again towards the end of the month.

Average high temperatures in August are a nice 22 degrees Celsius (or 72 F), and the lows are typically around 13 (or 55 F), or cooler as September approaches. Vancouver gets an average of less than 40 mm of rain in the month (or a bit more than 1.5 inches).
